poem:
Title: "Ticket to Renewal"

Beneath grey duvets of January chill,
Stale murmurs of resolutions unfulfilled,
Bingeworthy tales, crisps crinkling in surrender,
Awaiting the spring's compassionate tender.

Yet bids the great iron serpent,
A cheaper fare, an enticing accent,
To wrestle the creature of hibernation,
To breathe, to move, to seek liberation.
#New year, new journey--the saga unfurls,
In the rhythm of British rail's iron curls.
